body:
It seems like it crashes here: https://github.com/systemd/systemd/blob/b83847eb1321ee79e1ab073b79e3001320b839a4/src/basic/fd-util.c#L59-L79

Also the previous systemd version (256.9-1) exhibits the same issue.

92124838c6b7e09e3f35ff84e1eb63cf0105c9b5 enabled a pre-existing codebase that was left disabled (due to typo) since its inception (in 8.9.0).

It'd probably be more useful to fix the bug, or if this is not possible, drop this
functionality if broken. Reverting 9212483 only hides the issue.

edit: workaround for CMake: `-DHAVE_EVENTFD=0`. For `./configure` probably: `export ac_cv_func_eventfd=no`

I have disable support for eventfd for now:

https://gitlab.archlinux.org/archlinux/packaging/packages/curl/-/commit/1963701abfc6e9f20db4052c629fc842413828b2
https://gitlab.archlinux.org/archlinux/packaging/packages/lib32-curl/-/commit/1bebe929217d7a0024c3da0aa00a9fb191821460

But of course the root cause for this should be fixed...

I'm guessing the issue is that `Curl_eventfd` assigns the same FD to the read and write end of the wakeup "socket pair", and that results in `close` getting called twice with the same FD number.

If nss-resolve opens its varlink socket between these two calls to `close` and gets that very same FD number assigned, curl closes this socket and nss-resolve explodes.

Otherwise, curl gets an `EBADF` from the second `close`, which it ignores. You can see this using `strace`.
I think the bug probably involves the `wakeup_close` calls in [asyn-thread.c](https://github.com/curl/curl/blob/df1d08ec0daf06b0bf2fdebe2411631e08967a98/lib/asyn-thread.c).
@panjf2000 Would you mind taking a look?

Thinking about it, it should be possible to duplicate the file descriptor to get the same behavior with two FDs you can close separately. However, I don't think there's a variant of dup that duplicates the FD to an unassigned number *and* atomically sets CLOEXEC.

(And avoiding unnecessarily allocating file descriptors is probably prudent.)
I don't think we need to dupe it. Can't we just add an #ifdef for the eventfd situation and avoid closing one of them then?

issue.title: async-thread: avoid closing eventfd twice

repository.name: curl
repository.description: A command line tool and library for transferring data with URL syntax, supporting DICT, FILE, FTP, FTPS, GOPHER, GOPHERS, HTTP, HTTPS, IMAP, IMAPS, LDAP, LDAPS, MQTT, POP3, POP3S, RTMP, RTMPS, RTSP, SCP, SFTP, SMB, SMBS, SMTP, SMTPS, TELNET, TFTP, WS and WSS. libcurl offers a myriad of powerful features

issue.body:
When employing eventfd for socketpair, there is only one file descriptor. Closing that fd twice might result in fd corruption. Thus, we should avoid closing the eventfd twice, following the pattern in lib/multi.c.

Fixes #15725

body: Hi @christian-heusel, could you compile and run this patch #15727 on your machine to see if it fixes the issue? Thanks!
This seems to fix the crash, thanks for coming up with a fix so quickly ðŸ¤—

issue.title: Unexpected error 9 on netlink descriptor 60

repository.name: nix
repository.description: Nix, the purely functional package manager

license.name: GNU Lesser General Public License v2.1

issue.body:
## Describe the bug

```
copying path '/nix/store/l4z31s1x6p38j4b39fgnawwjhrwkn5j2-source' from 's3://...'...
unpacking 'github:hercules-ci/flake-parts/b905f6fc23a9051a6e1b741e1438dbfc0634c6de?narHash=sha256-%2Bhu54pAoLDEZT9pjHlqL9DNzWz0NbUn8NEAHP7PQPzU%3D' into the Git cache...
copying path '/nix/store/zd5dgszslv09jzybcpf25gpl12s6r2d9-source' from 'https://cache.nixos.org'/...
unpacking 'github:ipetkov/crane/9172acc1ee6c7e1cbafc3044ff850c568c75a5a3?narHash=sha256-SC0eDcZPqISVt6R0UfGPyQLrI0%2BBppjjtQ3wcSlk0oI%3D' into the Git cache...
unpacking 'github:oxalica/rust-overlay/cf960a1938ee91200fe0d2f7b2582fde2429d562?narHash=sha256-QOA4jCDyyUM9Y2Vba%2BHSZ/5LdtCMGaTE/7NkkUzBr50%3D' into the Git cache...
copying path '/nix/store/8m0a1amb8mflmjq4l78km5yda3igl1di-foo' from 's3://...'...
Unexpected error 9 on netlink descriptor 60.
```

Possibly related to https://github.com/curl/curl/issues/15725, fixed in https://github.com/curl/curl/commit/ff5091aa9f73802e894b1cbdf24ab84e103200e2 (unreleased).

## Steps To Reproduce

Seems to happen sporadically when pulling down sources.

## Expected behavior

Pulls sources successfully.

## Metadata

```
nix-env --version
nix-env (Nix) 2.24.11
```

## Additional context

https://github.com/curl/curl/issues/15725,

## Checklist

<!-- make sure this issue is not redundant or obsolete -->

- [x] checked [open bug issues and pull requests] for possible duplicates

[latest Nix manual]: https://nixos.org/manual/nix/unstable/
[source]: https://github.com/NixOS/nix/tree/master/doc/manual/source
[open bug issues and pull requests]: https://github.com/NixOS/nix/labels/bug

issue.title: curl: Unexpected error 9 on netlink descriptor 60
issue.body:
### Nixpkgs version

- Stable (24.11)

### Describe the bug

After updating `nixos-24.11` to `635e887b48521e912a516625eee7df6cf0eba9c1`, I'm running into error `Unexpected error 9 on netlink descriptor 60` while pulling flake inputs with Nix (using libcurl).



### Steps to reproduce

It's hard to reproduce, but this sporadically happens when fetching flake inputs with `nix`.

### Expected behaviour

Fetching inputs should work

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Relevant log output

_No response_

### Additional context

I'm pretty sure this is related to https://github.com/curl/curl/issues/15725 (fixed in https://github.com/curl/curl/commit/ff5091aa9f73802e894b1cbdf24ab84e103200e2, but unreleased)

I think it would be a good idea to apply this patch until curl `8.12` is released.

Arch Linux went ahead and disabled eventfd support in curl as it was causing issues with pacman: https://gitlab.archlinux.org/archlinux/packaging/packages/curl/-/commit/1963701abfc6e9f20db4052c629fc842413828b2

### System metadata

```
 - system: `"aarch64-linux"`
 - host os: `Linux 6.10.14-linuxkit`
 - multi-user?: `yes`
 - sandbox: `no`
 - version: `nix-env (Nix) 2.24.11`
 - nixpkgs: `/nix/store/zd5dgszslv09jzybcpf25gpl12s6r2d9-source`
 ```

issue.title: systemd assertion fail with transmission-daemon

labels.name: bug ðŸ›
labels.description: Programming errors, that need preferential fixing

labels.name: needs-reporter-feedback â“
labels.description: There's an unanswered question, the reporter needs to answer

repository.name: systemd
repository.description: The systemd System and Service Manager

issue.body:
### systemd version the issue has been seen with

257.3

### Used distribution

opensuse tumbleweed

### Linux kernel version used

6.13.2-1-default

### CPU architectures issue was seen on

x86_64

### Component

systemd

### Expected behaviour you didn't see




### Unexpected behaviour you saw

since december 2024 I find a problem with transmission-daemon that dump unexpectedly about once a day.
I reported the bug on the git of transmission and I got suggestion that the issue could be systemd related.
this is the but report I opened there: 
https://github.com/transmission/transmission/issues/7413

I then found out that it's actually systemd that fail in an assertion call and maybe send a SIGQUIT to transmission-daemon generating the dump.
I made a test and modified the transmission-daemon.service configuration setting Type=notify to Type=forking.
with the new configuration I didn't encountered any more coredump.

the message I see on systemd status transmission when crash:
```
Jan 24 10:21:22 xxx transmission-daemon[275872]: Assertion 'close_nointr(fd) != -EBADF' failed at src/basic/fd-util.c:75, function safe_close(). Aborting.
Jan 24 10:21:22 xxx systemd[1]: transmission-daemon.service: Main process exited, code=dumped, status=6/ABRT
Jan 24 10:21:22 xxx systemd[1]: transmission-daemon.service: Failed with result 'core-dump'.
Jan 24 10:21:22 xxx systemd[1]: transmission-daemon.service: Consumed 10h 43min 50.126s CPU time.
```


the configuration of transmission-daemon.service:

```
[Unit]
Description=Transmission BitTorrent Daemon
Wants=network-online.target
After=network-online.target

[Service]
# added automatically, for details please see
# https://en.opensuse.org/openSUSE:Security_Features#Systemd_hardening_effort
ProtectSystem=full
PrivateDevices=true
ProtectHostname=true
ProtectClock=true
ProtectKernelTunables=true
ProtectKernelModules=true
ProtectKernelLogs=true
ProtectControlGroups=true
RestrictRealtime=true
# end of automatic additions 
User=xxxx
Group=xxxx
#Type=notify
Type=forking
LimitNOFILE=50000
#ExecStart=/usr/bin/transmission-daemon -f --log-level=error -g /xxx
ExecStart=/usr/bin/transmission-daemon --log-level=error -g /xxx
ExecStop=/bin/kill -s STOP $MAINPID
ExecReload=/bin/kill -s HUP $MAINPID
NoNewPrivileges=true
MemoryDenyWriteExecute=true
ProtectSystem=true
PrivateTmp=true
Restart=on-failure
RestartSec=60

[Install]
WantedBy=multi-user.target


```
### Steps to reproduce the problem

_No response_

### Additional program output to the terminal or log subsystem illustrating the issue

```sh

```

issue.title: Unexpected error 9 on netlink descriptor - with libcurl/8.11.1

license.name: GNU Lesser General Public License v2.1

issue.body:
Created a script, using pycurl 7.45.4, based on the CurlMulti example here, with num_conn = 400:

retriever-multi.py
https://github.com/pycurl/pycurl/blob/master/examples/retriever-multi.py

This runs on Docker with Python image: python:3.12.9-slim-bookworm.

When running this, the above mentioned error occurs. This can take an hour, or several hours.

The same (?) error is also mentioned for example here:

Regression: File descriptor / Assertion error when using curl via nvchecker #15725
https://github.com/curl/curl/issues/15725

Turned on Verbose and after a long time the following messages appear, * = verbose:

* Could not resolve host: aabbcc
Unexpected error 9 on netlink descriptor 21.
* shutting down connection #31500

Then the script freezes on the next call to 'perform()'.

If this is indeed the same problem as mentioned on the curl github issues, then it appears there is a fix for this.

This is also mentioned here (?):

CVE-2025-0665 eventfd double close
https://curl.se/docs/CVE-2025-0665.html

No idea how to fix this with pycurl (needs rebuilding with 8.12.1 I guess).

sometimes my docker build fails with:

```
#21 20.66 Unexpected error 107 on netlink descriptor 11 (address family 10).
#21 20.67 Aborted
```


See maybe related:
- https://github.com/curl/curl/issues/15725
- https://gitlab.archlinux.org/archlinux/packaging/packages/curl/-/commit/1963701abfc6e9f20db4052c629fc842413828b2

Archlinux seems like disabled support eventfd to avoid this

issue.title: `Unexpected error 9 on netlink descriptor 34` during package add operation.

repository.name: Pkg.jl
repository.description: Pkg - Package manager for the Julia programming language

issue.body:
On Julia 1.12.1 I just ran into a segfault for no apparent reason (I didn't ^C or anything):
```
(MyPkg) pkg> add LinearSolve@3
   Resolving package versions...
Unexpected error 9 on netlink descriptor 34.

[933559] signal 6 (-6): Aborted
in expression starting at none:0
Allocations: 114568033 (Pool: 114562563; Big: 5470); GC: 144
Aborted (core dumped)
```

I realize that this won't be especially useful without an RR trace, but reporting anyway in case someone can figure out what went wrong from the debug info.

issue.title: libcurl v8.11.1: apply patch for netlink error fix
